feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: In S4 Hana Public Cloud there is only two control keys YBM1 & YBM2 , how to procure external service
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

In S4 Hana Public Cloud there are two control keys YBM1 & YBM2 there is nothing as PM03 as in on premise to procure external services.

In the above mentioned control keys if we add external work center with YBM2 control key its creating PR but that is not as item category D, which will not serve the actual purpose of external service procurement. 

Though  it could be achieved directly by adding Services in Service Overview, by linking external operation, but this is creating an additional extra line in PR which is non relevant to purchasing.

Could anyone help is there any possibility in S4 Public cloud to create a PR with item for SES, automatically from external operations as with control key PM03 (on premise), given there is no order type configuration in S4 Public cloud.

entry.title: Standard Costing Input Parameters in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,
I am working on a Discovery phase project to assess whether SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition can support our client's standard costing process.
I need to confirm if the following input parameters can be configured in the standard costing calculation (Scope Item: BEG - Standard Cost Calculation).
Required Input Parameters:

Design BOM - Bill of Materials created by design department
Production BOM - Bill of Materials with theoretical quantities
Process yield loss rate - Defect rate or scrap rate at manufacturing process level
Actual material consumption quantity - Including material yield/scrap considerations
Manufacturing version - Version control for BOM and routing
Work instructions / Activity types and rates - Labor and machine hour rates
Work center - Production resource master data
Material master - Item master data
Standard material price - Standard purchase price for purchased materials

Questions:

Can all of these parameters be maintained in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
If any of these are not supported in the standard functionality, what are the recommended workarounds or alternative approaches?
Specifically, I'm concerned about process yield loss rate and material yield/scrap - where should these be configured?

Any guidance or reference to documentation would be greatly appreciated.
Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: Manage multiple internal numbers and quantities per Delivery Item in Outbound Delivery Creation
entry.content:
Hello All,

Users need to record and manage multiple internal numbers (internal lot, sub-ID, or internal reference) and corresponding quantities under one delivery item.

The total quantity across all internal numbers should equal the delivery item‚Äôs quantity.
Ideally, we would like to create these as add-on fields and add table in Create Outbound Delivery app - Item level but seems couldn't find a way to do it.

Then, we would like to output this on printing template as well

Example Scenario:

  • Outbound Delivery: 80001234

  • Item: 10 (Material ABC-100, 10 pcs total)

  • Internal split required:

Internal No Quantity
INT0015
INT0023
INT0032

May we get advice if it is possible to add table to standard business object?

Thank You.

Regards,

Chin Yee

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition(GROW) scope item; production order without PP master
entry.content:
The past QA seems that it's possible to use production order without PP master instead of CO production orders(KKF3) in SAP S/4 HANA cloud public edition (GROW). 

CO Production Order Issue in S/4HANA Public Cloud - SAP Community


I checked scope item 3F0 as mentioned answer.
It seems there are reporting functions for event-based processing costs, work in progress, instructions, etc. but it does not include the registration of manufacturing instructions or the entry and exit of instructions.
I have checked other scope items and I have confirmed that it is possible to register, issue, and receive instructions for items without a PP master (BOM/operation procedure) in BJN scope item (production order type:YBW1). However, since this scenareo is merely a rework manufacturing instruction process, I think that cases where items without a PP master are manufactured are outside the standard.

Based on the above, there are any scope items that can increase production inventory without using the PP master?
And if so, what is the ID?

OR,  is it OK to use for production without BOM or work procedures even if BJN is a scope item intended for rework?

entry.title: Order combination flag ignored in STO delivery creation (S/4 Public edition)
entry.content:
Dear experts,

We're facing the issue that the "Order combination" tickbox is ignored when creating deliveries for stock transfer PO's, although the flag is active in the STO line items. A function that has worked in older SAP versions without any issues, but doesn't seem to work in S/4 Public Edition. The suggestion was made to investigate the usage of BADI "LE_SHP_SUPPRESS_DEL_SPLIT"(Suppress Delivery Split), but that BADI only considers Sales order items (VBELN_VA), thus no Stock Transfer items.

The default delivery splitting criteria are all identical in the STO's we're shipping:

  • Shipping Point
  • Ship-to Party
  • Route
  • Shipping Conditions
  • Delivery Priority

Also, symptoms as described in note 3310234 - Delivery split is issued during replenishment delivery creation based on STO - SAP for Me are not applicable in our case. So, why are deliveries still created per STO in S/4HANA? Any suggestions/advice is welcome to resolve this issue.

Regards,
Corn√©

entry.title: How to Create a Custom Report for Purchase Orders with Approval Details in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
As part of a purchasing process optimization project, I needed to create a custom report in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud that displays:

  • Purchase Order Number
  • Creation Date
  • Purchase Order Date
  • Approval Status
  • Approver Name

This report is essential for tracking the approval flow and identifying bottlenecks in the procurement process.

üîç Approach

To achieve this, I used the Custom CDS Views app to build a tailored data source, and then created a Custom Analytical Query to visualize the data.

üìò CDS View Design

Primary Data Sources:

  • I_PurchaseOrder ‚Äì for PO header details
  • I_PurchaseOrderApprovalStatus ‚Äì for approval status
  • I_WorkflowTask or I_WorkflowInstance ‚Äì to retrieve approver information

Key Fields Included:

  • PurchaseOrder
  • PurchaseOrderCreationDate
  • PurchaseOrderDate
  • ApprovalStatus
  • ApproverName (via workflow task assignment)

entry.title: Production variance settlement to CO-PA (instead of Cost center)
entry.content:
In S4HC Public by standard the production variance settlement (PRD) is posted against a profitability segment (CO-PA), whose profit center corresponds to the one maintained in the material master of the product manufactured. 

In S4HANA on-premise, we could configure the settlement so that a cost center (we called it "technical prices") was the receiver of the production variances (PRD), and when CKMLCP is executed, the PRY postings are made against that cost center, and together with the rest of PRD posting and other ML operations (transaction keys), the balance was 0 at period-end closing. If there was any balance in any material due to non-assigned/distributed price differences, we could easily assess them to CO-PA using allocation cycles. 

However, in S4HC Public, since the production variance (PRD) is posted against a PSG, the remaining amount in the "technical prices" cost center corresponds to that production variances + if there are any non-allocated/distributed balances, so that no automatic CO-PA allocation can be done, forcing the client to do manual posting to CO-PA (substracting manually the production variances amount) and besides we fail to the premise that all cost centers must be cleared out at period-end closing so that FI and CO result is the same.

How are you dealing with this matter in other clients? Can I do some kind of substitution to change PSG to cost center? Could SAP release the custo point to change the settlement as in on-premise? 

Thanks. Regards,

entry.title: SAP TRM Migration to Public Cloud ‚Äì Cash Flow Transaction/Facility Object Missing?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I‚Äôm currently working on a migration project involving SAP TRM (Treasury and Risk Management) in the public cloud, and I‚Äôm looking for insights from anyone who has experience with this.

From the migration object list, I noticed that Interest Rate Instrument (IRI) and Letter of Credit (LoC) are included, which is great. However, I couldn‚Äôt find any mention of Cash Flow Transaction/Facility as a migration object.

Before I proceed further, I wanted to ask:

  • Has anyone here have an experience in migrating TRM objects to the public cloud?
  • Specifically, did you encounter the same issue with Cash Flow Transaction/Facility not being listed?
  • If this object is indeed not supported in the standard migration cockpit, did you end up using LSMW or another workaround?
  • Any lessons learned or recommendations would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Difference between ECC CO Production Order and S/4HANA Public Cloud PP Production Order (3F0)
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

In ECC, we use CO Production Orders for manufacturing cost management.
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, we understand that Scope Item 3F0 (PP Production Order) is used instead.

Could you please clarify:
1. What are the main functional differences between ECC CO Production Order and S/4HANA Public Cloud PP Production Order?
2. What functionalities are available in PP Production Order (3F0)?
3. What functionalities from ECC CO Production Order are NOT available in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
4. Are there any alternative approaches to cover the gap?

entry.title: Alternative to ECC Cost Planning Transactions (KP06, KP26, KSPI, KSII) in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

In ECC, we use the following transactions for cost rate calculation:
- KP06: Cost input
- KP26: Quantity input
- KSPI: Unit price calculation
- KSII

We understand that in S/4HANA Public Cloud, the recommended apps are:
- F3162: Manage Cost Rates - Plan
- F3422: Manage Cost Rates - Actual

Questions:
1. Can we still use KP06, KP26, KSPI, KSII transactions in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
2. What functionalities are NOT available with F3162 and F3422 compared to the ECC transactions?
3. Our current process calculates the following standard rates using KP06/KP26/KSPI:
- Standard labor rate
- Standard factory overhead rate
- Standard subcontracting rate
- Standard product overhead rate
- Post-process common overhead rate

Can we achieve the same calculations using F3162/F3422 in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

entry.title: Automatic GL Account Substitution Based on Cost Center and GL Account in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Current ECC Process:
When posting costs to specific Cost Centers and GL Accounts, the system automatically converts and posts to designated GL accounts based on a conversion table.

Business Rules:
1. If Cost Center = R&D Department ‚Üí automatically post to "Research & Development Expenses" GL account
2. If Cost Center = SGA AND GL Account = 9XX (SGA accounts) ‚Üí automatically post to "Selling, General & Administrative Expenses (for P&L display)" GL account

Conversion happens in real-time during posting using a custom conversion table (Cost Center + GL Account ‚Üí Target GL Account).

Questions:
1. Is this type of automatic GL account substitution possible in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
2. If yes, which app or scope item should we use?
3. What is the recommended approach for this requirement in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

entry.title: Best practice for changing the default currency of analytical Fiori Tiles in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear Ladies and Gentlemen,

I found an read some SAP notes for my task of changing the default currency of analytical Fiori Tiles in S/4HANA Public Cloud, but I am not really sure, what is the best practice and the easyest way to do this.

The user profile settings for language and the default values > General > Display Currency obviously have no effect on the analytical tiles for example in the space "Accounts receivable" > Analytics (there was also a note that this just works for some tiles)

Also there does not seem to be another globel setting for the S/4HANA tenants to change the standard currency for all tiles from USD to EUR as far as I see?

So the only way really seems to be to user the "Manage KPIs and Reports" app auf S/4HANA Public Cloud and change the default currency the in the settings of each indivdual KPI (for eacht tile) and then transport this?

And probably now in S/4HANA Public Cloud I can do this directly in the KPIs provided by SAP without the need to copy each tile and KPI and create custom versions for currency = EUR for all those tiles (as it was proposed in earlier S/4HANA on premise versions)? And those settings will not be overwritten with the next S/4HANA cloud release?

Thanks a lot and kind regards


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Internal Order Alternative in S/4HANA Public Cloud - Which Scope Item for BS Account Posting and Inv
entry.content:
In ECC, we use Internal Orders for:

1. Posting costs to BS accounts (e.g., Work in Process, Advances)
- Pool costs temporarily before allocation
- Code starting with "3"

2. Posting costs directly to P&L accounts (e.g., Cost Variances)
- Immediate expense recognition
- Code starting with "4"

3. Issuing inventory materials to these orders

We understand Internal Orders are not available in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Questions:
1. Which Scope Item(s) can replace Internal Order functionality?
- We checked 35E (R&D Project Management) but it seems to support only P&L posting

2. Can any Scope Item support:
- Posting to BS accounts for cost pooling?
- Direct material issues from inventory?

3. What is the recommended approach for our requirements?

Current usage:
- Manufacturing industry
- R&D department uses these for expense management
- Need to pool costs in BS accounts before period-end allocation

ERROR : 422 Unprocessable Entity

entry.title: Transport the GL account with implementation status "do not used" into TST and PRD system?
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

Understand that GL account with implementation status "do not used" will not be transported into TST and PRD system.

However, i am getting error below when displaying the configuration in TST system because the GL account implementation status is "do not used". Hence, any chance that i can trsnport it to TST and PRD without removing the SAP standard configuration?
